We're working on more stories right now
Inside the House leadership scramble.

                AP Photo

            By 
Seung Min Kim

10/15/15 01:23 PM EDT
As Paul Ryan continues his will-he-won’t-he dance around a potential bid for speaker, other House Republicans are stepping up support for the House Ways and Means chairman’s would-be opponents for the job. 
In a letter sent to House Republicans Thursday, Rep. Steve King (R-Iowa) implored fellow GOP lawmakers to back long-shot candidate Rep. Daniel Webster (R-Fla.), a former Florida House speaker who’s earned the support of some of the House’s most conservative members. 
“The best candidate, Daniel Webster, is gaining momentum for his demonstrated leadership,” King wrote in the letter, obtained by POLITICO. “Dan is arguing for a principled member-driven approach that will transform the culture of the House. His approach will bridge the divides currently running through our Conference.”
King -- who has said he would not back House GOP leadership candidates who have supported immigration reform efforts -- made clear where Webster stands on the issue, telling lawmakers that Webster has an “excellent record opposing amnesty.” The conservative House Republican also touted Webster’s policy credentials as “staunchly pro-life, pro-traditional marriage and a defender of the Constitution.”



            By 
Nick Gass

“No one in the Conference has raised concerns to merit opposing Daniel or the demonstrated principled leadership at the foundation of his candidacy,” King wrote. “To bring the Conference together in support of the cause of conservatism, I hope you will join me in announcing your support for Dan Webster for Speaker so the momentum behind his race will continue to grow.
And though he doesn’t mention Ryan’s name, King wrote: “[N]o candidate running or rumored to run has matched [Webster’s] commitment to conservatism or bottom up governing.”
The House Freedom Caucus, a hardline group of GOP lawmakers credited with helping to oust Speaker John Boehner (R-Ohio) and derailing the speakership bid of House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.), has also formally endorsed Webster. Webster earned 12 votes on the House vote for speaker in January.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: King made clear where Webster stands on the issues.
title: Steve King says House should elect Webster as speaker
